org.meltzg.jmtp

Class JMTP

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.meltzg.jmtp.JMTP
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Closeable, java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class JMTP
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Closeable
    A singleton implementation for accessing and modifying the content of MTP devices
    Author:
    Greg Meltzer

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static JMTP getInstance()
        JMTP instance retrieval function.

        Since the underlying native implementation maintains certain information at runtime, only a single instance of JMTP can be instantiated

        Returns:
        The JMTP singleton

           throws java.io.IOException

      • getDevices

        public java.util.List<MTPDevice> getDevices()
        Returns:
        a List of MTPDevices currently attached to the machine

      • selectDevice

        public boolean selectDevice(java.lang.String id)
        Selects a device by ID to operate on. All subsequent content access method calls will use the selected device
        Parameters:
        id - The ID of the device to select
        Returns:
        boolean if selection is successful;

      • getDeviceContent

        public MTPObjectTree getDeviceContent()
        Enumerates the selected device, returning an MTPObjectTree. If unsuccessful, returns null.
        Returns:
        MTPObjectTree content of the selected device.

      • transferToDevice

        public java.lang.String transferToDevice(java.lang.String filepath,
                                         java.lang.String destId,
                                         java.lang.String destName)
        Transfers a file from the computer to the selected device
        Parameters:
        filepath - The path of the file to transfer
        destId - The ID of the location on the device to transfer the file under
        destName - The name to give the transfered file. The '/' can be used to create intermediate folders (ex. "these/are/folders/for/file.mp3"
        Returns:
        The ID of the file that was transfered. null if unsuccessful

      • removeFromDevice

        public boolean removeFromDevice(java.lang.String id,
                                java.lang.String stopId)
        Removes an object from a device. If the specified object has children, all of its children will also be removed. If stopId is specified, all parent objects with no more children will be removed until stopId is reached or an object with children is encountered.
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the object to remove
        stopId - ID of the object to stop deleting parents
        Returns:
        true if successful, false otherwise

      • transferFromDevice

        public boolean transferFromDevice(java.lang.String id,
                                  java.lang.String destFilepath)
        Transfers a file from the object to the computer
        Parameters:
        id - ID of the object to transfer
        destFilepath - path and name to transfer the file to. all intermediate folders will be created if they do not exist.
        Returns:
